Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the severity of the coronavirus infection in Tijuana by stating that it is the most heavily infected place anywhere in the world.
Understate: The claim understates the infection rate in Tijuana by not acknowledging that San Diego, California has a higher infection rate.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any data or evidence to back up the statement that Tijuana is the most heavily infected place in the world.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the number of cases alone determines the level of infection, without considering other factors such as population size or testing capacity.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to acknowledge that there are other cities, such as the District of Columbia or Queens County, with higher infection rates than Tijuana.
